column4: Ubuntu is not only for newbies. And I work with several sysadmins and programmers who use Ubuntu, GUI and all.
So, I'd like to get some opinions on this, if possible.
Unfortunately I can't get online from the affected machine, since eth0 is not being detected at all after a recent power outage/reboot. It's an onboard Ethernet card on an ASUS M3N78
I'm at rather a loss here. It was showing up perfectly before the system lost power. Rebooted it, and dead nothing, not in dmesg, no nothing. I only show lo in ipconfig.
sudo lshw -C network ?

I get no results on stdout, just stderr scrolling by. Trying to pipe stderr to a file stops the flashing text, but results in an empty file. The only thing that stops long enough to read is PCI (sysfs)
You have to wait for lshw to finish running to get the output
sudo lshw -C network > network.txt
Then that means that it's not even seeing a network device on your system.
Yes, that is correct. ifconfig shows only lo.
Which means the power outage probably killed the card.
Try shutting down, reinstalling the card and see if it comes back up.
It's onboard on the motherboard, you figure it killed only the NIC?
It may have a static charge on it.
It can happen, especially if you got a power surge through the ethernet line.
Doublecheck the BIOS and make sure it's not disabled there.
Well, worth a shot. I'll check in the BIOS, I can also pull a PCI NIC out of another machine to test with.
If it's not disabled in the bios then chances are it's dead.
The ethernet cable runs through the ups?
Yes, it does, the UPS has an in/out Ethernet that runs to the router, and then an Ethernet from the router to my machine. The router's power cord is also plugged into the UPS.
Best of luck to you sir. Perhaps it was just it's time to "die".
if the battery is dead then it may be running in passthrough mode, meaning it's essentially a surge protector.
I think you were right, and it won't recognize anything. Even trying with a PCI card from another machine and a live CD, it won't recognize a thing.
Sounds like your mobo got nuked sir, so very sorry.
